Hello everyone!
Now let's review one of Navel's masterpiece of visual novels translated to anime.
It is a school life anime, but even with some extraordinary features from some characters, very, but very little of this aspect is used. So little in fact these "powers" just appears sometimes in the story, so a little slice of life is present. Romance is the main emphasis of the anime, and no, the main character doesn't save the world here (not directly by any means).
--Story--
How everything begins, and why everything happens. (Skip if you already read synopsis)
Rin is a typical high-school main character, living under the same roof as Kaedesince they were children. In his school, humans aren't the only one who studies there, but also boys and girls from both heaven and hell, which some also happens to be Rin's friends, like Asa, his senpai from heavens, and Mayumi, another childhood friend who came from hell, dedicated to be journalist. A certain day, two girls, one from heavens and another from hell, joins the school and automatically wants to be together with Rin. Their fathers, kings of heavens and hell, go to the school too, and says Rin have to make a choice. Either he chooses one of those girls to marry, or they'll destroy the Earth itself.


Lots of love affairs, gossips and indecisions begins from there on, but I won't mention then or else I'd be spoiling the anime...


--Time exploitation--

Some animes makes time pass faster when watching them, and some do the opposite.


Shuffle stands a little between in this case. Having the average duration of 24 episodes, filler scenes are inevitable, but if you played the Visual Novel, you'll find out the anime follows most of the script of the game, so it isn't as bad as you might think. The anime itself, in the beginning, dedicates a whole episode mainly for each one of the main girls at a time for introdutions, then following with a brief series of episodes (basically 2 eps for each) telling a bit deeper about the girls, some secrets of them, their past and how they met Rin in the childhood and made them follow in love with Rin, and finally, Rin's decision, followed by the final chapters about the couple. After saying all this, you can say the anime doesn't stop for long, so yeah, it exploits time well, but could be a little shorter.


--Story and Characters Evolution--

Story (usually) grows as time passes, but how about the characters?


Tough topic. After the "introductory" episodes, the story evolves at slow steps until Rin make the decision for himself, so the story is mostly intact after the first episode until quite late in the anime. The main girl's "arcs" (meaning, on the episodes dedicated to them and their past/secrets) only serves as a background for who's watching the anime and who the watcher would pick in Rin's place, since it has a single ending only. Then you'd say "Isn't it time wasting, seeing the other character's backstory then?". Yes, but I'd consider this marketing plans to support all the other Shuffle!-branded games, audio and drama cds, mangas, radio novels, and so on, where you have multiples endings and stories about if he'd chosen other girls.


In other words, the characters remain static on most part of the anime, except on rare occasions and in the final chapters (I'll tell later).


--PERSONAL Opinion--

Exactly what it means. What I think about the anime ^^


Shuffle! is that love-or-hate kind of anime for me. At the time, I loved the anime, and I've played to VN later. For me, I didn't faced the character's backstory as "time wasters", because you end up sympathizing with the girls, and on certain moments, with Rin, since he has to decide only one from 5 girls and also having his own tragic backstory told in the anime. The best aspect of the anime, indeed, is the final chapters. In most animes, the girls would still be hitting on Rin after he made his choice, but here, all the others go on, some easier than others, changing their shyness and dreams, searching for other guys and just remaining good friends with Rin (girls: friend zoned!!).


It's really a mix between unreal and realistic anime, not because of the presence of magic and heaven/hell population, but as for the girls' static behavior along most of the anime. It's just sad. Sexual content is really short and present mostly on the first episodes to crack a laugh, but after this, it's very serious. Character design is full of details and decent motion, and even with static characters, each one has her own personality, so you'll end up falling in love for at least one of them, even on secondary characters (Kareha-senpai *-*)


As bad aspect, not to mention the obvious again, the music could really need an improvement, except for the opening theme, that alone made me watch the anime. Maybe if the anime didn't followed the game so strictly it could have been shorter and better, but again, I don't consider these aspects major flaws


-- Score and Recommendation--

Final score to me and to what people I would recommend.


8.5/10.0


If you like romance/school-life/slice of life animes, without a doubt you should watch this. For the others, only if you have the patience to wait the story reach its climax or have played the game before (it has translations to english ^^)

For all of you that have read the bad reviews for this anime, please don't let it judge the show for you. Watch it for yourself and see how great/horrible it is. 
As for me, I enjoyed this anime from start to finish. It is definitely a harem anime but what surprised me the most was the amazing character development. 
Story - 9
The story wasn't perfect, but it caught my attention right from the start. I am not going to lie, but it does start out like any other harem anime. Although, I can't blame it. I mean, how else are harems supposed to introducecharacters? 

As the story goes on, you will learn the other side of each character that you will never expect from them. At certain points, you will tell yourself, "Pft, I bet the story is going to continue like this!" Later on, you will definitely have a different perspective.


Art - 10

Beautifully made characters and romantic scenery. I like how they actually gave meaning to each place the scenes take place in and eventually use them at later episodes to emphasize/develop characters.


Sound - 8

I guess it was okay. The dub actually wasn't bad and had a lot of famous voice actors from other dubbed animes (the good ones).


Character - 10

As I mentioned from previous points, the characters are very well developed and you will see so many unexpected turns as the story progresses. It is true that the main character's decisions/actions aren't always quite soothing to the mind and heart, but later you will appreciate him. The ending satisfies all fans of each female character so it won't leave you angry (or at least raging if you're a die-hard fan of a specific female character).


Enjoyment - 10

By now, I think everyone knows what I will rate this category. The story flowed so well, from easy-going to romantic and finally dramatic scenes. All the characters have traits that everyone will love! You won't be disappointed with any lead character. If by chance you get disappointed in the middle of the show, please finish it first before getting mad at them. ;)


Overall - 10

Outstanding. I will recommend to any fan of the romance/drama genre! Also, I will surely revisit this anime in the near future!

Although Shuffle is a kinda old anime now, I still felt like I had to make a review for it, because I felt it was a little underappreciated. This won't change that, but maybe it will help one or two people discover this anime.
I have also played the VN before I watched this anime, something I don't think other reviewers for this anime mention. I'll talk about that at the overall section.
Story: The story is pretty great. It starts off as a typical harem rom com, but by the middle, that is when the anime really starts. That's when everything begins to really come together,and you will know when it happens. When the comedic relief starts to disappear, stuff get's real. 9/10


Art: For its time, the art isn't bad. Inconsistent, a little, but not too horribly. It's also somewhat unique, as I haven't really seen anything quite exactly like it, although I must admit to not having seen much anime from this period. 7/10


Sound: It's noticeable, I think, and I feel that it truly does help to enhance emotions in the sad and happy parts alike. The only thing that holds it back is lack of variety. 8/10


Characters: This is really where the anime shines above all else. Character development becomes important and prevalent halfway in, so it's definitely there if you can get there. Although many other people say that jealousy and anger and emotions similar to them should be more prevalent in the girls, considering the MC takes a while to choose, you also have to consider a couple of things.


Nerine and Lisianthius are not human. This may not seem to be very important, but it also means that they don't feel or react like a human girl might. There is a culture gap there. You can easily tell why Primula wouldn't feel like that. Kaede and Asa are the only ones that feel this, but only eventually, and this is due to life problems, and for one of them, serious mental issues. 9/10


Enjoyment: I really enjoyed this anime. I watched it very happily, and it wasn't a waste of time at all. 10/10


Overall: The VN this is based off of, wasn't very good. I enjoyed it, but it was short, it didn't let you connect with the characters enough that you cared much when their story got tragic. In the anime however, this problem is taken and shattered.


All unexplained things, almost all loopholes, are resolved in the anime. Not only that, but the VN was short. I finished it in about 10 hours. So, 24 episodes is actually kind of a lot. But, the anime took everything in the VN, cranked it up to Super Saiyan 4, until the anime took a life of its own. The stories and characters connect with you deeply, and you actually feel the emotion.


The girl Rin chooses was definitely unexpected for me, but it also made sense to me. And the routes are all finished almost completely, (minus the endings where they get together and everything, obviously) with tons and tons of new material that adds to it.


If you're looking for a faithful adaptation, this isn't for you. However, it is a GOOD adaptation. Which is really rare, ESPECIALLY for a VN adaptation.


Overall, I rate this anime a 9/10, one of my top 5 favorites now.

I disliked Shuffle! so much that it has prompted me to write my first review. That does not mean that you will dislike it, but if you've seen one harem anime, you might end up being bored by Shuffle! The review will contain some minor spoilers, but nothing major or explicit.
Story: 3
Let’s start off with the premise. In a world where Devils, Gods, and Humans coexist, a mediocre guy has 5 girls fall in love with him for pretty stupid reasons. Sounds like your standard harem tromp with a supernatural element thrown in. This premise had so much potential; the interactions between the three worldsand their inhabitants could have been developed and fleshed out instead of providing fillers and needless drama (24 episodes were more than enough for that). They could have answered the question about how the gates between the three worlds opened (God knows they had the time to do that). However, we never even get a glimpse of the world of Gods, and just some episodes where we get to see very little of the world of the Devils. The differences between the three races are never specified, except for the fact that Gods and Devils can use magic. I know it's a harem, but adding these elements would not detract from the original story. Some of the developments in the story seemed to happen just for the purpose of drama and they were so easily resolved (read: cliché) that it made you wonder why they occurred in the first place. After around 11 episodes, the anime starts feeling a bit too much like a visual novel, with the MC doing each girl's route (with annoying numbers of pantie shots thrown in each). I know it is a VN adaptation, but it felt TOO much like a VN compared to other adaptations. I will admit, some developments the final episodes were surprising (the good kind) and they made sense within the framework of the story. 



Art:

The anime is a bit dated, so I cannot really comment on the art. If you're used to new anime, you might get a dated feel from the art, but it isn't bad to look at, though the character designs take some time to get used to. Could have been better if they spent the budget on something other than pantie shots.


Sound: 7

I really liked Shuffle!'s OP, and the ED wasn't bad either. Other than that, the sound wasn't anything special.



Characters: 2

The characters are what make or break an anime for you, and in my case, they made me dislike Shuffle!. I've seen enough harem anime to not expect originality from them, but still, let’s get out our stereotype checklist. The pervy friend with the glasses: check. The cheerful, happy go lucky one: check. The subservient one who will do anything for the MC: check. The shy one with the manners: check. The loli: check. The emotionless one who eventually shows emotions: check. The one who likes getting physical: check. The intrusive parent(s): check. Other spoilery clichés: check. Clichés and stereotypes aren't necessarily bad if done well. They aren't done well in Shuffle!. Two of the girls have essentially the same back story. Every girl calls the MC kind.... but the MC is actually kind of a dick. He is indecisive and the annoying thing is, because of his MC status, he essentially resolves everyone's problems by himself. He is pretty selfish in some respects; he leads on the girls for most of the story because he wants things to remain the way they are. They couldn't have made the girls more passive and one-dimensional in terms of problem resolution, and the loli feels more like a side character. At a certain point in the story, I thought he had chosen a girl, but no, by the magic of a badly written story, all that had happened between them was essentially forgotten. A pretty horrible MC, even by the standards set by the harem genre.



Enjoyment: 3

The reason I finished Shuffle! was because I actually sorta enjoyed the first 10 episodes. After that, it slowly degraded, and then I was in too deep to stop watching, since I wanted to finish the story. I'm the type of person who will end up marathoning a whole anime on the weekend if i don't control myself, but I ended up finishing Shuffle! in 10 days, and I only finished the last 5 episodes in one go so I could be done with it. The ecchi is overly abundant, badly done and detracts from the story. Hope you like striped panties if you've decided on watching this anime. 



Overall: 3


To conclude, Shuffle! is an anime with a lackluster story with potential which pulls you in the start, and some of the most boring and pathetic characters you might see in an anime. Its sound and art might be its redeeming features, though I wouldn't watch an anime solely for those two things. I haven't watched a lot of anime, but even I found Shuffle! annoyingly clichéd. I didn't hate it, hate is a strong word, but I came pretty close. To conclude, except for the fact that it actually ends conclusively, Shuffle! might just be everything wrong/boring/annoying about the Harem genre, especially if you've already seen a few anime already.

Alright, lets dive right in.
Story: 9/10
I think the story was very well executed, and while the beginning seemed slow, the story's progression and enjoyment ramps up, and it doesn't make all the characters sappy. It had a good mix of tragic and happy, and I think I thoroughly enjoyed the ride. The romance's presence is very remarkable, but not so much that other important things are covered up. 
Art: 7/10
Since this is an anime from 2006, it has the "old style" art, which, to be frank, is not one of my favorites. It doesn't have any vibrant colors, definite lines and vectors, or robust artstyle of a lot of modern anime, but it isn't bad either, and the story more than made up for it. 


Sound: 7/10


Again, not amazing, but not horrible. It was good and served its purpose, no more, no less. 


Character: 9/10


Amazing character development, they were each unique in their own way, and had their own set of problems. They didn't really follow any kind of trope, and how they marked each character's uniqueness was very well done. 


Enjoyment: 9/10


While I was bored at first, it served me well to get through as the story and character interactions got better and better and more intense. I very much enjoyed the ride that this show gave me. 


Overall 9/10


Very well made, and very fun. Not a lot of post-coupling action, but the build is very well executed. I would recommend this to a lot of people.

I'll start by saying this. Harems are harems - you should know what you're getting when you sit down to watch the genre. Having said that, Shuffle! is pretty much everything you want out of a harem without being too predictable. 
The story is pretty good overall and the characters are great. A harem without good characters is really just the worst. This show is a little more fun/light and comedy-based but it gives me Clannad vibes a bit. It certainly doesn't match Clannad's awesomeness but it's a good show if you're looking for something similar (aside from the other Key VN stuff).

"Shuffle!" had some surprises from the Harem genre...Not all of them good...My overall rating of about 7 is cos I really tried to generously execute "suspension of disbelief", and cos it left an emotional impression on me.
As I have read in other reviews, "Shuffle!" indeed follows the typical harem anime formula for roughly the first half of the 24 episodes, which was fun for me.  The King of the Gods and the King of the Devils were hilarious to me, and, as another reviewer has written, I would indeed like to see a spin-off with them!  I enjoyed the character development of eachof the girls, and found myself caring more for them than for which one would get to be with the MC.  The MC is nothing more than a thoughtless prick who gets handed to him ridiculously cute girls, who all are in love with him cos of one act of kindness done years before...And who does nothing else "kind" but for 3 scenes with 2 of the girls.  Nonetheless, I still enjoyed the comedy in the first half, and especially enjoyed the girls' look and art.  There are indeed many panty shots, if that's your thing.  Titty shots are there, but mostly in scenes that were not hot (e.g., one girl is in the shower in extreme depression--Sorry, but not my thing).


But then, about halfway through, the story takes a heart wrenching turn with one of the girls...Ok, so fine...You then get an episode, or so, break where the characters say, repeatedly, "we're back to normal" a bit too much...Then it just gets downright DEPRESSING!  Characters you grew to like are simply cast aside to develop a relationship between 2 characters that I just didn't think was plausible, given how everything had developed up to that point.  And it happens after a majorly humiliating event that I just couldn't buy!  Keep in mind, I was willing to accept that years ago, a "gate" opened that connected the human world with Gods and Devils, and everyone is living in harmony and everyone is cool with that!  


At this point, it just becomes sad...One by one, girls I liked are now systematically eliminated from the "harem competition" due to their "dark" pasts, and lives are ruined by the MC selfishly being "honest" after stringing them along for so long.  This culminates in what can only be described as "soap opera" BS.  That being said, as I thought this out, I realized that perhaps this was symbolizing life as one progresses from the protected bubble of junior high, then high school, only to be met with the harsh reality of the real world and making the hard decisions.  Too artsy-fartsy?  Maybe... But this was why I gave it a better rating.  Not because I enjoyed that aspect...But because it reminded me that all things do change/progress whether you like it or not, and in ways you may like or not.


Overall, I would say to someone about this anime, watch the first half and enjoy yourself.  After that, be prepared for a 180 degree emotional roller coaster that takes you into dark reality.


Finally, the King of Gods and the King of Devils, Primurula and Siga are the best characters!:)

To be honest I watched many harem anime but this one blew my mind. The Anime started off as a demon god harem comedy with girls competing with each other ( like in a normal harem anime) over one of most pathetic MC you will ever see. When you can become a demon king or god or both but you choose something off the list is when it drives me up the wall. Moreover MC is a pussy who thinks he can make others happy by friendzoning all the girls after that choosing someone who is off the list and he realise he has hurtingwhat was once precious to him by ignoring them he tries repent his sins by running away from home living separately because he think he was spoiled by the care given to him by someone who loves to serve him. More even being surrounded by beauties MC can't figure out his feelings whom he should date or should he date. If you like harem ROM com which stays on the track then this anime is not for you

The Bad:
Rin isn't the best main character I've ever seen. He's basically Jesus and acts as a panacea for every situation, this is probably the biggest criticism I have for the writing in this series. There are various scenes where the characters are having a conversation, yet they'll focus on one character who isn't speaking for a majority of the scene. This one small aspect could have been fixed by looping two or three frames so that they're not putting pressure on the animation studio. There are a few exceptions to this rule, but I when you're covering the speaker, it ends up looking lazy.The pacing was also everywhere. I also really didn't think his friend was necessary, you know who I mean, right? The perverted supporting character? I can't remember his name.\n\n
The Good:\n
This series is really well written for a harem series. It has a varied cast of female characters that more than make up for Rin's bland character. Each of the characters ends up getting a good amount of character development over the short 24 episode run time. When the series needs to have good animation it does, and the animation adds to the scenes (which is why I would suggest watching it dubbed over subbed). If you watched this subbed think back, which scene was the most emotional for you, was it the scene where Remu just kind of walked around the house in a depressive state? Well, that's more so what it's like with the dub. The great vocal performances from the entire voice cast also added a lot to the feel of the series. this series has a lot of now-famous voice talent in it voicing main characters, so it was honestly really nice hearing what was the beginning of the Funimation voice cast. Overall this series was very good and I would suggest checking it out if you have the time.

Shuffle is a bad anime.
Obviously, you shouldn't expect a gripping and touching masterpiece that perfectly blends romance and harem from an anime that's based on an dating sim (or whatever this game is), but this show doesn't isn't particularly H either. The fanservice is so poor all you get in the first half of the show is a wet-shirt event with a fucking  loli (fucking meant as adjective, not a verb). Anyone who agrees that this show classifies as ecchi must be an exotic mix of celibate amish muslim raised in an underground cell, deprived of any stymuli of human contact. I guess someonelike that would indeed consider a plot involving a guy living togerher with girls (again, not "living together", they really do nothing more than share the same house) sexually stimulating.

There's no real plot, backstories that are revisited every 2-3 episodes are so shallow that a lobotomized viction of a brain stroke high on painkillers couldn't make them more bland and implausible.

Main character is a typical harem MC, in a bad way, being a freeloading girl jail-bait without a bait (he just attracts girls that want to dedicate their whole existences to him, because he actually was nice to them 10 years ago (the madman). And by saying "was nice" I mean "he helped a stranger girl to find her way back home, this kind of thing. Not "good childhood friends" nice).


More on the technical side, the art is so 2005 bland I'm having childhood flashbacks, and the voice acting sounds like the VA were forbidden to approach microphones closer than 5 meters.


However, the anime is not any kind of atrocity, and while it doesn't have a single good thing about it, it's still watchable. Think Slice of Life written by a little girl, starring all her dolls. or maybe an ecchi show devoid of any connection to human sexuality. It's not painful to watch, but doing literally anything else is most possibly more entertaining.

The daughter of the King of Gods and the daughter of the King of Demons move in next door.. Now what?
There's 3 girls clambering for his attention;
Lisianthus Eustoma, Sia for short, the princess of the Gods.
Nerine, or Rina, the princess of the Demons.
And Kaede, Rin's childhood friend whom he lives with.
Then Primula and Asa Shigure come along.
All the girls are beautiful, adorable and sweet. But you can tell there's secrets and possibly darker things lurking in their pasts.
It starts off really fun, lots of comedy and story building. You get introduced to the characters and see little snippets of the past. 
The Ecchi is there,but it's mostly subtle. To an extent, anyway.\n
Then it has it's sad parts, starting toward the middle and continuing from there.\n
The second half is definitely more serious, and gives the anime itself more appeal. It seems to bring everything together. The drama and secrets start coming out and turns the story around completely.\n\n
For a good mix of comedy and drama, Shuffle has it!

That me perference this by saying. There is no logic, reasoning, or basis for my score here. This is pure unadulterated Favoritism of the highest order. This is something that can't be explained by simply Critiquing it. This was the show, the first anime that was out of the main-stream for me. I look back at this show with the same rose colored glasses that I wore when I first watched it. So instead of giving you a reason to watch the show or have people rage over my blatant favoritism. I dare anyone to not look back at there 1st and not look backat it as fondly as i do here. (Excuse the Sexual Innuendo of that statement)

When I was first recommended Shuffle! I was put off by the gods/demons side of the plot. I'm not a fan of excessive supernatural elements in school based anime. That reason alone resulted in me avoiding watching it for a very long time, which was a shame because I was already aware of how outstanding the art style, quality and character design was.
After watching a few series, I came back to Shuffle! and decided to look past the supernatural elements of the story and the pointy ears and just give it a go. I have to say I'm very glad I did. For anyone elseput off by fantasy elements in anime like this, please just ignore it as you'll find it really isn't as bad as you'd think. Although the Gods and Demons part of the plot is relevant at times, it doesn't really involve anything more than a source of comic relief for the majority of the series. So, if you like drama, school, comedy, harem or romance then get Shuffle! watched.


I'm extremely picky when it comes to artwork, being an artist of sorts myself. By definition, I wont watch a series unless I like the art style and character design. Shuffle! has fabulous character design and the art quality and animation is top notch at all times. If you're looking for some well made anime, the art quality of Shuffle is definitely a 10/10. The last show I watched with this quality of artwork was Clannad, which also happens to be my favourite anime. Anyone who's familiar with will have a sense of just how well done the artwork of Shuffle! is. Definitely one of its strongest points.


The general story of this anime isn't really anything original. You have your main guy and several lovely ladies who all happen to have a thing for him. The series essentially revolves around this lucky guy named Rin having to choose one of these girls. Of course, as expected in this genre, Rin is pretty clueless when it comes to girls and even worse when it comes to making a decision.


The thing which really highlighted Shuffle! for me was the character development. In Shuffle! every single one of the main characters gets almost equal screentime. This is particularly important for a show like this, because it allows the viewer to establish which girl they'd like our lucky guy to end up with, in an entirely fair judgement, due to them all getting their equal chance to shine. There are a lot of other shows which fail to do this, and the fact that all of the characters were so well explored really helped me enjoy Shuffle!. In addition all of the girls have their own unique sides which really sets them apart from each other. Some are more shy and lightly spoken, whilst others are outgoing. We have those who are somewhat of a tomboy and others who are very lady like. 


The comedy elements of Shuffle! aren't outstanding but it certainly never gets dull. Of course a few of the characters don't really have a funny side, but others are complete comedians. Overall Shuffle brings out a few laughs every now and again, sometimes with originality, sometimes not. If you just want to sit back and enjoy a calm comedy/drama while you work then give it a go.


For those wondering there is a bit of fan service present in this series here and there. In many anime reviews people complain about this, but for me it doesn't boost or lower the rating. I don't feel it was excessive, and in some ways it actually helped bring out more of how certain characters think. So, I wouldn't call it excessive, and since the art is so beautiful I don't think it is anything to complain about. If it really bothers you then just close your eyes.


The second half of the series focuses more on story than comedy, unlike the first half. In the second half we have a lot more drama, but still the occasional comedy. All of the characters are explored once again, in most cases in more detail, and this detail tends to bring more intensity to the show. 


For the most part I thought the writing wasn't incredible, but its definitely of a decent quality for this kind of show. The one story related thing I was disappointed with was predictability. This isn't to say the whole anime is predictable, because there were certainly moments which really surprised me, but in the last half of the anime some of the more dramatic scenes were a little too predictable in places. Without spoiling anything, one thing which was a pleasant surprise for me was who ends up together. I wont say who, but he ends up with who I designated my favourite character right from episode one. Lets just say as much as I loved her I certainly didn't expect her to be the choice, in fact I thought she'd be one of the last, so that was a nice surprise for me which definitely bumped my rating of the show up and made the last six or so episodes of the show far more enjoyable.


For those like me who prefer watching the English dubbed version of anime, I'd like to talk about that. When I originally came back and reconsidered Shuffle! I checked out the cast. Judging from the names I have to assume I didn't look at the cast the first time I was recommended this show, or I would've probably watched it then. There are some great actors in this, and in general although a lot of people seem to disagree I thought the English dub was outstanding. Some characters are definitely better than others but overall the English dub was great. Britney Karbowski and Carrie Savage did a great job bringing their characters to life, and Monica Rial gave an absolutely flawless performance as usual. If you're one who goes for dubs you should like this cast.


Overall Shuffle! is a fun, easy going anime with a nice balance of comedy and drama, and a unique use of character development. If this is the type of genre you're interested in I honestly can't give a reason to avoid it. As many have stated it definitely isn't anything original, but the artwork is outstanding and all of the characters are lovely and perfectly developed. It isn't often for me that I like all of the characters, but in this case I did. At the very least I usually have one of two characters who annoy me, but this is definitely absent in Shuffle!. I would've liked to see a real second season of Shuffle! perhaps resembling the format of Clannad After Story, but at the same time the ending did have me satisfied.


Shuffle! isn't a series which will have you sitting in a pool of tears by the end, or something which will give you a lot to think about or change your life, but it definitely is one of the good shows of it's genre. As I've already said, if you like the genre and you like well designed anime then give it a go, or at the very least watch the first few episodes.

When I first started watching Shuffle! it seemed like any other harem/ecchi/romance anime which I'd watched so far. I even dropped the series after 14 episodes. However, out of sheer boredom, I decided to give it another shot and I must say I was quite pleasantly surprised. 
The first half of the series is quite typical and mediocre. You get to know the characters and witness the typical harem nature of most anime in the said genre. You also get to witness a fair amount of ecchi. The latter half though takes quite a twice in the plot and this is where I really enjoyedit.


The characters seemed to mature to quite an extent. Although it did maintain the harem nature to the most part, it seemed a bit more mature I suppose. The latter half is also where you get to witness true romance. The romance between two character (whose names I will not mentions :P ) is tried and tested quite deeply. It's purely for the romance side of the plot that I chose to rate it 8 (whereas I rate most other harem/ecchi 7 at most).


In my opinion all those who enjoy watching anime of the romance genre will enjoy this (if they can be patient with the first half that is)!

Rin Tsuchimi is one of the most underdeveloped main characters I've ever seen. He lives with his equally underdeveloped, life-long friend named Kaede who's only goal in life is to cook and take care of her precious Rin; not that he cares.  Despite his lack of character, every girl in anime land STILL wants him.
You're probably wondering by now why I gave this such a high score. By the time I got to the end of the episode I found the set up so ridiculous that I was actually laughing and so I clicked on to the next episode. Then the next. And I'mreally glad I did.


The focus on this anime is not really the male, of course, but all of his female interests. Kaeda's persona gets fleshed out to reveal a dark regret. Other characters include Sia, princess of the gods and Nerina, princess of the demonds, and Primella a young demon. All three have their own secrets to reveal.


Magic doesn't play a huge role until the second half of the series and while the buildup to the finale  was great I found the reasons for conflict a little, well, stupid. Overall though, Shuffle! has some great moments that will reward people if they give it a chance.

Shuffle was an anime that changed the way I look at anime forever. 
Shuffle was the 4th anime I had ever seen(school days being first, boy was that a mistake, and a few really ecchi ones). I came in looking only at the romance factor and the 18 and over rating. What I got on the other hand was an anime that would forever live in my "Hall of Fame" Animes so to speak.
Story - 10
The story was unexpected, and that I believe made it even more magnificent. Prior to this I had seen titles like Omamori Himari, Kiss X Sis, and HOTD. They wereanimes that didn't lack a story line, but didn't have a suprising or "hanging-on-the-edge-of-your-seat" story line that Shuffle! has. It made me realize that anime isnt just big boobs and panty shots. I also like the fact that its all HUMAN emotions. The drama, the romance, the joy that they all experience is all realistic and I could easily see it happening in real life(except the whole angel demon thing). I also re-watch it and LOVE the fact that he choses a girl in the end. No the crap in every other harem in the world where he decides that he'll just love all of them equally.


Art - 10 

I am no art expert, but I thought it was done really well. The characters were well done and are all rather unique. The backgrounds were well done and everything looked crisp. Its exactly what I look for in "good art" in an anime.


Sound - 10 

Once agian I am no expert. But I found myself listening to the OP and ED when the episode began and ended. By about episode 14 I had most of the OP memorized and decided that I had to have it on my iPod. I listen to it to this day(I watched this about 1 ago ago).


Characters - 10

The characters were by far my favorite part of this anime. Just about everyone had an amazing backstory.They were all compelling and a couple of them brought tears to my eyes. The main character is your run-of-the-mill super nice guy who helps everyone and is to dense to realize six beautiful girls love him. But theres something about him that makes him different, maybe the way he talks or the way he does thing makes me like him even more. All the other characters seem to be once agian your overused and cliched(tsundre, loli, childhood friend, shy girl, energetic)characters. But they put a twist on all of them. And by twisting these cliched personalities, you get somthing unquie. Something that makes you want to know more about them and why they ae like that, all of which are answered.


Enjoyment - 10

I enjoyed this anime immensley. It brought joy, saddness, and the wonder if there would be something as great as what I had just watched. It opened my eyes to a new horizen of anime. No longer stuck in the "if its ot ecchi, its not good" phase I went through.


I reccomend to anyone, no matter what genre your into. 


Team Sia for life!

Shuffle! Is an anime that may seem like a typical harem anime where the girls compete with each other to get the guy, BUT towards later on in the story a lot of surprises happen that no one can expect, you girls and guys might as well start guessing who he will end up with! 
I know you may think that he will end up with either the god or the demon girl's but who knows it may happen, not going to give out any spoilers but it is a true shock of what will happen the first 15 episodes are introduction to the charactersin my opinion and then the real story starts , this is a very good anime to watch if u enjoy romance / drama / fantasy , with some comedy.


This anime packs a lot of secrets and unexpected turn of events all i can say about this certain anime is do not judge a book by its cover ! you may be bored the first 4 episodes but you will enjoy the anime if this is your kind of genre


What to expect - expect a good ending ! it will give u closure and make you happy that you finished this anime because it is well thought out! this anime contains Drama / Romance / Comedy / Slice of life / Fantasy , If this is not your kind of genre I do not suggest it to someone who enjoyed an anime such as hellsing and prefers to watch action over anything else

Look, I have to be frank with this, and i realize that I might take a bit of heat for what i say here but whatever, I feel like this series could have been far better. A harem anime that defied conventions and tropes, you just have to wade through a pile of fluff just to get there...
Shuffle! is an anime adaptation of the *ahem* H-visual novels with bleached underpants but having uncensored nudity and it follows ordinary high school student Rin Tsuchimi voiced by Tomokazu Sugita who lives with his childhood friend Kaede Fuyou voiced by Yuuko Gotou when suddenly his ordinary life is abruptly changed when the Kings of Devils and Gods appears before him and telling him to pick one of their daughters, Lisianthus "Sia" Eustoma voiced by Sayaka Aoki of the God faction or Nerine voiced byNaruka Nagami of the Devil faction so that he may become the King of Devils or Gods and thus the harem hijinks and later on, the in-depth serious character development of the cast comes in.


Spoilers Ahead!


LA wasn't kidding when LA said that the first half of this anime is nothing but the entire core cast having the typical harem hijinks and it becomes a slog to get through, basically ALMOST becoming filler, LA says "ALMOST" due to the fact the fillery fluff harem hijinks actually does contribute to setting up the majority of the core cast and their soon to be character development while at the same time focusing on some minor characters like Mayumi Thyme voiced by Miki Inoue, a friend of Rin's and one part of the comedic relief for the school and the core cast's teacher Nadeshiko Benibara voiced by Mari Oda before getting into the more serious character development.


There's lots to unpack so let's start with Primula voiced by Hitomi, she has relations to Nerine, but she becomes sick and we later found out she's something of a homunculus, experimented to see the heights in which magic can be grown but her magic goes haywire in a ways. Primula is the first step towards the world building of Shuffle! but we at least get some backstory on her as she's probably the most mysterious character within the series and she become something of a satellite character together with Kaede later on. Yes LA will say she's the least developed character in the series but we at least see a behavioral change through all the events after her arc ends nonetheless.


Next is Nerine and she has some baggage and to be honest the rest of the harem does to some extent but Nerine has links to Primula as well. Well her backstory helps things with why she fell in love with Rin but at the cost of her identity, yup she played that card but it's more like she's accepted her own identity at the cost of a sacrifice from her past and this all being instigated by Primula's arc in the first place.


Sia even before her "arc" appeared she had the majority of the screentime and vying to be the girl who wins in a ways, but her "arc" was the shortest of the harem, her dealing with her "split personality" as it were and her personality switching from playful to almost femme fatale and her wanting to suppress the latter due to her like Nerine having to sacrifice something form her past. Where Nerine was accepting her identity by ultimately leaving her other self, Sia was actually having the identity crisis and accepting BOTH sides of her personality.


Kaede is up next and ohh boy was this the most interesting arc out of all of them, playing and deconstructing the trope of the childhood friend as part of the harem as we see some of the most infamous moments within the series, see Kaede as a childhood friend at first wasn't the pleasant, calming and caring childhood friend she was to Rin, as an incident involving Kaede's mother made Kaede place the blame on Rin and utterly tormented Rin to the point of wanting him DEAD, but when she found out the truth she tried any way to retribute her sins any way possible and LA sees this both ways, as Kaede didn't know at the time and placed blame on Rin but going to the extremes she did especially for some of the torment she made Rin go through was utterly deplorable and guess what with Rin distancing himself from Kaede and breaking routine as it were, well breaks Kaede's facade and goes back to her almost yandere state. The thing is this is a brilliantly, visceral depiction of what happens to an extreme spectrum of what the childhood friend not being chosen is like and with the classic trope of the childhood friend not being picked but the "first girl" was something of a refreshing breath of air as it were seeing this side of things,as visceral as it was and even the climax though somewhat anti-climactic was dealt with extremely well, quite honestly the best arc of Shuffle! if anything.


And finally Asa Shigure voiced by Miki Itou, Rin and Kaede's tomboyish friend and the eventual one true pairing the anime picked and we get little hints of Asa's backstory throughout the anime   but things only finally reveal themselves once her arc and the final arc starts and it ties up all loose ends with all the hints given and quite honestly some of the plot twists concerning Asa and her mother Ama voiced by Yuria that came out of nowhere but made perfect sense plotwise. If there was anything to say about Asa's arc was that it kinda dragged at bit but nonetheless with it's conclusion and wrapping up the anime itself, it was actually decent.


In terms of characters and how much the entire core cast changes over the anime, they at first are stereotypical characters but the core cast at the very least develops and in the case of Kaede breaks convention even for the time it was released of 2005, but if LA had to pick a favourite character then it would of have to Asa Shigure, quite obviously for her calming laid back attitude and having some decent backstory to go along with her in which her potential as both the genki character of the series but ALSO playing up the "sick character" in nice conjunction. LA's least favorite and yes LA had one....was Sia. LA just didn't liked her hogging the first half of the anime and her lack of screentime even DURING her arc and the final nail being her squeaky voice was why.


The rest of the minor cast are comedic relief to say the least with some development as characters, those ONLY being the aforementioned Mayumi and Benibara, but there are also Itsuki Midoriba voiced by Hideki Ogihara the womanizer of the school comedic relief and one of Rin's friends, also both dads of Sia and Nerine are also put into the comedic relief pile, with Sia's dad being the bigger one from the two with him getting the most slapstick out of the dads. When the comedic relief is away, you know the anime is getting serious. No seriously if ANY of these characters don't even get a mention or screentime in any episode, it's all serious character development which is at least tonally consistent.


FINALLY, what about Rin?, our main protagonist, well to say he's the typically dense main male protagonist IS correct but like his harem that develops over time, so does he and he for the typically dense main protagonist DOES develop as well as well as actually choosing one of the harem, heck he even moves on from his typical routine, sure it was to help and protect his loved one, but nonetheless. TONS of people hate Rin being the idiotic dense main male protagonist stereotype but besides his white knighting idiocy at times, he too does grow to be a better character. LA just wished that some of his choices were a bit more planned out.


LA talked ALOT about the characters and well Shuffle! is VERY character-centric, but what about the production value. The animation done by Xebec and asread was decent enough for the time and with the distinct character designs and backgrounding was good. Comedic relief has the typical chibi overracted faces and all, but when the anime got serious, it bloody shows and LA means the psychotic Kaede faces. Ohh and the uncensored nudity, well it being adapted from a H-visual novel, well it was a given to be honest.


Voice acting wise, well LA aforementioned that LA really didn't like Sia's squeaky vocals from Sayaka Aoki, but aside from that, well Primula's voice actor Hitomi was VERY quiet BUT there was a plot reason so LA could give that some grace. Really there are TWO voice actors LA needs to give major props to, Miki Itou as Asa as she was in her 40's when she was straining her voice to sound like a 17 year old and LA COULD HEAR IT STRAINING. The other and most obvious being Yuuko Gotou as Kaede because DAMN could she switch easily from calm and caring to outright psychotic.


Shuffle! like it's namesake (LA hopes) is of the choices one makes, makes sense due to the arrows being something of a key point and what Rin and his harem went through, well it wasn't the typical harem LA was expecting and it is actually one of the VERY few harems LA has experienced in some time where the entire core cast and even it's minor cast gets time in the limelight and was executed rather well, whether it be themes of identity, sins of the past and moving forward, but where the anime falters is the first half where it does nothing but play around and LOOK like a typical harem anime when clearly it's second half is NOTHING like it but giving small hints to the bigger picture later on. 


Shuffle! is one of those harem anime where YOU NEED to watch the anime fully, even if it's first half is all fluff and no substance as it's second half is one, extremely satisfying towards it's characters you'll be investing in and two, just Kaede's arc in it's entirety giving us something that defy conventions of the childhood friend stereotype and finally a something of an actual ENDING towards a harem anime and heck a main male protagonist who moves forward for the one he loves?...heck ya.


Color LA surprised Shuffle! for the most part executed itself quite well in all regards, the core cast being developed and the changes stick, childhood friend trope being played and deconstructed to impressive degrees even if it goes into edgy, batshit crazy territory and a main protagonist that changes along with his harem, if you can slog through it's first half, then you will the satisfied one way or another, LA was certainly was.


Childhood friends NEVER win amrite?...

The only redeeming features that this anime has are the artwork and the sound, and even those are fairly mediocre and simply typical art for the early 2000's. 
While I remember watching about half of this anime when I was younger and thinking it was pretty decent, upon finishing it recently, I realize just how awful it is. The story, scripts, and character design are all dreadfully mediocre. The entire anime can be summed up as follows: 
An incredibly simple protagonist who doesn't know how to clearly tell women that he's not interested forms a harem with girls he knows at school, some of whichare demons, and one of which is his psychopathic childhood friend. The girls all fall in love with him just because he's "kind" and that's it. Nothing else. He has no redeeming qualities other than he's "kind" which ends up causing more harm than good as he never makes his intentions clear. By the end, he ends up with a girl that didn't have nearly the same amount of character development as the other characters (nearly in harem anime where the lead character ends up with one character, a good amount of time is spent on that character specifically with the other "arcs" simply acting as additional content to flesh out the world and interactions with other characters, not simply go from one girl's arc to the next, in order, so that the last one's arc is the one he ends up with with no real development leading up to that point) and, quite frankly, was an odd choice, in my opinion, for the girl he ends up with. 


tl;dr 

A guy is "kind" to some girls -- including demon girls --, they end up absolutely in love with him, and he's not clear with his intentions which simply leads to cliche and incredibly mediocre "drama." 


The last several episodes don't even feel necessary. There's no need to have a whole 24 episodes. The same story could have been told in 21 or fewer. In fact, to be quite honest, this should have just been a 12 episode anime, from the start. There's not enough depth of story or character depth to keep it going for as long as it did. 


I watched the Japanese dub (as I always do) and this is one of the first times where I've watched an anime and felt that the Japanese dub was fairly poor. Almost the entire cast just came off as really whiny compared to most high school slice of anime casts. 


The only reason I finished it was simply so I could mark it as "completed" and never think about it again. That, and because I like Nerine's character design. That's about it. This is one of the first, and so far one of the only, animes I've ever regretted watching.

This review will contain some minor spoilers in regards to plot direction, but I will do my best to not include any specific details
Shuffle! really took me by surprise in a lot of good ways. It  is a harem comedy with some supernatural elements to it, there are plenty of girls to choose from with a main character that is fairly average in every way, except of course his luck with women. Now that is pretty standard, but Shuffle! takes risks in the plot department you don't usually see in harem anime of this type, and I feel that is to be commended. 
Whilemost harem anime tend to revolve the harem around a different plot entirely, Shuffle! is different in that the plot is the harem itself. Due to this, Shuffle! really does it's name a lot of justice for the majority of the show, with almost every character getting at least one episode of their romance being explored with the main character. Unlike most shows of this type, the main character Rin Tsuchimi is completely aware of the girl's affection for him, and spends most of the show trying to decide on which one to pursue romantically. This was really a fresh of breath air for me, when so many male protagonists embrace the Orimura Ichika (Infinite Stratos) style of obliviousness to the affection of those around him.


In direct contrast to that obliviousness, not only does Rin actively realize and address his harem's love and affection, but he even ends up choosing a girl to pursue and love above all others. As someone who has watched a lot of harem anime, that really surprised me. Now sure, in my opinion he chose the second best girl to pursue in this case, but that's not the point. The point is that this main character actually has the testicular fortitude to decide on what and who he wants, and make something of it. The only other MC I've seen do this has been Hyoudou Issei (Highschool DxD), but Issei decided in the first episode (and never gives up his dream for it to be a true harem style ending), whereas Rin fully explores his options - shuffles through if you will - and only truly decides at the end. 


That being said, watching this also gave me some insight into why this isn't done very often. When there are multiple girls madly in love with one guy, choosing one creates problems that have to be dealt with. It gets messy and complicated, and I now understand why writers would have the main character NOT explicitly choose one girl, especially when there is an overarching plot line that needs to be addressed. The MC's choice is guaranteed to make a lot of people unhappy no matter who he chooses, and dealing with the fallout is a huge task of it's own. Shuffle! handles all of this spectacularly, because moving forward with a romance is the plot, and the rest of the major events are the subplot - exactly the opposite of what you would expect.


When it comes to that subplot however, there are some concerns and some things done right. The world of Shuffle! is one of Gods and Devils, but calling them Gods and Devils is a little disingenuous. They come from two different worlds, one for each, who have seemingly always been in contact with each other, and 10 years prior to the events of Shuffle a gate opened and all 3 worlds became connected. 


However, these gods and devils aren't nearly as different from each other as you would think they would be from the name, and whatever the deal with the gate is is never found out. Essentially, gods have short elf ears pointing up (and are polygamous, boiyoing), and devils have long elf ears pointing down. That's it. That's the difference. They're both nice, they work together, and the King of the Gods and the King of the Devils are best friends and live as neighbors in the world of humans so their respective daughters can have a shot at Rin.


Fleshing out this world is really the weak spot of the show. A lot of questions are raised about the world that is being shown, but very little is ever answered. There are scientific experiments resulting in sexy artificial beings as is to be expected, but no real villain or outside threat. The plot is the romance, and it definitely is fleshed out, but very little of anything else introduced results in a definite resolution or answer. This is the danger of the MC actually choosing a girl and dealing with the consequences as I stated above, very little else gets resolved.


The artwork and character design are good, but obviously a bit dated. You get used to it pretty fast but it's clearly an anime that's reaching 10 years old. The characters develop well though, and shows a great deal of depth for every one of them due to each one getting their time in the spotlight with Rin. 


Now it's time to talk about the fan service. It's there, nipples are drawn, but it's very casual and light for most of the series. I'd say that while it is definitely fan service, but most of it is done in a very classy way. Not a whole lot of gratuitous panty shots or "Oh no I fell down and landed with my head in your crotch and hand on your boob" moments. I wouldn't argue if it had more fan service, but what it does have is enough and is at least par for the course, though usually not particularly stimulating.


Overall I give this anime a 7/10. It's definitely good, but there is also a lot of room for improvement. A lot of things are brought up only to never be explained or even addressed. The Gods and Devils could just as easily have been called high and low elves and avoided a lot of unnecessary questioning and confusion by removing the gate altogether. That being said, the main romantic plot is incredibly satisfying for anyone who is tired of the MC of a harem being completely clueless and indecisive. I would suggest watching this to anyone who enjoys harem/romance anime resulting in an actual resolution (though albeit a resolution that isn't absolute), isn't bothered by slightly dated animation, and doesn't mind that there is basically no other plot other than the harem romance.

[Spoiler Free]
While I do enjoy Harem Animes, I personally think this is one of the best out there. I liked the anime a lot overall, but like most animes, there is always something they could have changed. But the nice thing about this one, the things they could have fixed were very minor.
Story wise, it had a pretty common plot. Multiple girls fall for the same guy, but that's what makes harem animes... well... harem animes. The unique thing about each of these girls was they were either humans, demons, or gods, so each of them were different, and each character had an individual storythat molded in with the entire story. While I found entertainment in each one, there were those small moments that seemed unoriginal. Overall, really good.


Artwork, awesome. What can I say, I liked the scenery, the character art, pretty much everything. That's why I envy the artists who drew for the show, they're good at what they do. I can't complain about any of the art.


Sound was a solid 9. The voice actors and actresses put emotion into their roles, so it seemed realistic, although there were some "overly-emotional" moments in the show... but I can honestly say I approved of all the actors/actresses they got to play each character in the show.


Characters were all lovable... everyone except for Itsuki. As everyone knows, harem animes always have a perverted best friend in the show (Daigo from Hoshizora e Kakaru Hashi, Saruyama from To Love-Ru, etc.). I honestly hate all of the perverted best friends in most harem animes, but the main characters are all good. For once, the guy all the girls likes isn't a pervert who fawns over them, which was what I was most impressed with. All the girls were unique, cute, and easy to like. The most interesting thing about each of them was their split personalities and secrets they hide. I liked all of them.


I enjoyed this one a lot, although I can't say I was amazingly pleased with the ending of the show. Like I said before the review began, I won't give away any spoilers, but I will say I wish it would have ended differently. I did enjoy the show though, honestly I did, there wasn't a high amount of fan service in this anime (also another thing I was impressed by), and there was a lot of comedy in the show. Really good.


I hope you found this review helpful.

Shuffle! is a harem anime based off a visual novel, as you probably already know. Beyond that, the series completely lost me.
Story: When it got to a certain point for me, there story blew right past me and everything kind of went downhill. Guy meets one girl from the past, then another, and soon has all sorts of girls around him. Typical harem, nothing special.
Art: For the most part, I have found that animes that come from visual novels tend to have good art, and this series was no exception. The overall art to me wasabove average, but nothing that stands out.


Sound: Meh. Again, nothing special. Voice actors aren't bad. For instance, the voice actor for the main male protagonist Rin also did Kyon in Melancholy of Suzumiya Haruhi. Nothing particularly bad about the overall sound, but wasn't great either.


Character: I should really be giving this a lower score...The fact that some of the main characters were introduced for no apparent reason in the end really hurt the series. Still, anyone looking for a harem anime will find that there is a girl for almost all the general categories.


Enjoyment: I didn't like the ending. There's nothing much more to say. Again, the fact that some main characters did not have a big impact in any way at the end really hurt. Other than that, I almost thought the series was going to turn out like School Days for a moment, and I almost stopped watching the end altogether.


Overall: If you want a harem anime, it's right here. If you were looking for a romance series between the main male protagonist and one of the more main female protagonists, prepare to be badly disappointed.


6/10

"Shuffle" started of as typical harem anime with a pretty weak plot, things got more serious in episode 12 but still not heavy enough for me, the REAL DEAL that makes it so exciting started from episode 19, it's what got me really hooked to this anime.
What I loved is the development of the character, the anime is mainly pretty cliche but in the last quarter of the anime unexpected things keep happening, it's hard to predict what's going to happen next and it's definitely not your typical harem anime.
Some people hated the mc for being undecisive at the start but what about the otherharem anime mc? most of them don't even have the guts to choose only one girl. He developed the courage to finally choose one girl even though he knows he would hurt the other girls in the process, because he realized that leaving things unresolved is not a good thing.\n\n
If you're looking for the usual happy go lucky harem anime then this might not be the right one for you since it has some depressing moments, you must grew up enough to accept the harsh reality of choosing ONE girl in a harem, the characters that resemble him the most I could think of is the mc from White Album 2 or True Tears.\n\n

This anime succesfully make me crying watching it... each girl have their own problem but it's almost similiar problem loving someone when she doesn't know the true feeling from someone that they love.... Overall, this anime is masterpiece for those who like love/romantic story...

If you're not into harem, this might be the series that could get you into it. As what it did with me. 
At first, one might be hesitant to see Shuffle! as any different from all the other generic harems out there; and, in some aspects, that's correct. Shuffle! is, by and large, a harem anime based on the life a teenage boy surrounded by beautiful teenage girls. There are some typical ecchi moments, awkward silences, confessions, etc., but Shuffle! manages to set itself apart from the crowd.
First off, the story arc of the series might seem typical for the first few episodes, and itwill seem familiar. But, what's different about this one is that two of the main heroines already LOVE our hero, Rin, coming into the story. Already quickening the pace of the entire anime, forcing the other girls that had been interested in Rin to either step-up or step-down. This gives the viewer a sense of relief. The frustration levels that someone typically might have while watching a harem, or any other romantic anime are pleasantly limited, but not erased. Leaving the viewer with a warm satisfied feeling after each episode has been completed.


The actual story is really quite good. Adding in mix of the old, "tried and true" practice of harem, with some deep twists and emotions not often seen in the genre. I think that the viewers will enjoy the way that the show gradually eases you into the deeper parts of the anime. Which obviously come later in the series.


The fantasy aspect: I'm not one who is particularly keen on watching any romantic anime with the word "fantasy" in the genre. This series does an incredible job at limiting the fantasy aspect but not too much so that the viewer forgets that it is. Overall, it's nothing over-the-top and I think everyone can appreciate that. 


Most importantly of all: this is probably the first harem anime I've seen in which the hero, Rin, decides on the girl he loves BEFORE the last episode. I find this truly refreshing and you get to see their relationship develop and blossom before the final episode. It's almost like watching a fanservice epilogue, except you still have a few more episodes to go before it ends; and their decision to show his final choice is one of the key reasons that makes this show great.


Story: 9 (Don't be hesitant, if you are, about it being partly fantasy. This show's story is a mix of harem goodness and original storytelling.)


Art: 7 (Eh, not the best. But some scenes and lighting really are great)


Sound: 9 (Both the English dubs and subs are some of the best I've seen. Plus, the voice acting is almost flawless)


Character: 10 (Very well-developed characters. You really feel like you know them when you reach the end.)


Enjoyment: 9 (I dare you not to have fun when watching this. I dare you.)


Overall: 9 (One of the best animes I've ever seen. Hoping for a legit second season.)

Alrighty, this is my very first attempt at a review, i hope its good =P.
*Story* 8/10
The story for shuffle was above average for me, although it is your usual harem, the anime had instances where you could laugh out loud, as well a great climax, fan service seemed overpowering however (although this is supposed to be a harem ecchi), however the fan service provided did not totally derail the story itself. At times i wanted to just continue watching episode after episode, just because of the cliffhangers provided in the story. Overall the story was an enjoyable ride for me, and i strongly recommend thisseries. (and the ending was really really unexpected... *cry*).


*Art* 8/10

Artwork remained consistent throughout the anime (however i noticed a slight difference during the ending episodes, however this may have been just the file), the artwork itself is detailed, and the anime itself simply looks beautiful. The environment was nicely done, and details like reflections were great.


*Sound* 7/10

The BGM was nothing outstanding, it wasn't overpowering, however i felt that it needed a bit more. Reflecting on this anime right now, i cant even remember any BGM that was really memorable. The seiyuu's were the only highlight of the "sound" with the emotions of the characters expressed profoundly and executed without flaws, eventually leaving me close to tears during some of the most poignant parts.


*Character* 8/10

Like every harem/ecchi each character has a problem (trust me lol), the characters in Shuffle! are no exception. The development in each character was smooth at the start of the anime, and the whole idea of gods and demons (which made me think that it was going to turn out random), was actually a plus in the development part. Each character (be it human, demon or god) was given their own traits, which were developed to the extent that i loved every character, however nearing the conclusion of the anime it seemed that the development of each character just came to a standstill and i felt that everything was rushed towards the end.


*Enjoyment* 7/10

Shuffle! was an enjoyable anime throughout, when i first started i just couldn't stop watching, even during the conclusion of the anime (which i hated for reasons i can't disclose, else ill spoil it), the anime still remained enjoyable.


*OP and ED* 9/10

The OP was upbeat, the ED was reflective, what more could i ask? Perfect transition into and out of the anime, the OP and ED of this anime has been added to my collection of all time favourites. (Reminds me a bit of how i felt whenever i watched True Tears)


*Overall* 7/10

What stops this anime from being great is probably my own little bias for the conclusion to the anime, i felt that the ending was rushed and a bit half-assed (excuse the language), and i really thought it could end better differently. However this is my own opinion, im sure other people may find the ending very enjoyable. (Note, i wont be watching Shuffle! memories, as i don't want to =S).


Hope you liked my first review

At first glance, Shuffle seems like your average harem anime. And as you watch a few episodes, you realize that... well... its just that. Shuffle doesn't go off the beaten path. If this is not your first harem anime, you won't see anything new. The story is quite linear, and the characters will seem familiar. But nonetheless, it's still a fun and enjoyable show.
Story: 6
The setting is original. In fact, its the most original aspect of the entire show. The idea of having humans, gods, and demons coexist in harmony is great in theory. However, the setting isn't exploited enough or in the right way.So in the end, the original setting sticks out like a sore thumb in a show where everything else is run of the mill.


The overall story wasn't bad. The pacing was good, with several arcs and character development at the right time. 


Animation: 8

No complaints here. Characters were drawn and animated beautifully, and the environments were detailed. But in the end, level of animation is just bells and whistles, especially in a character oriented harem anime.


Sound: 7

The soundtrack of Shuffle wasn't anything extraordinary. But it did its job, which was to set the mood for the scene. 


Character: 6

In a romance story, the character is the main course. It is the difference between an unforgettable experience and a total waste of time. Unfortunately, this is where Shuffle falls through the floor. The characters all fall into old archetypes. In trying to keep the tone of the anime light, the dept of each character was sacrificed. As a result, I was unable to relate to the experiences each individual went through. This devastates the anime, as the drama will feel forced and out of place. Fanservice was also used way to often to compensate for the lack of personality of each character.


There was also an entourage of support characters whose roles I wasn't quite sure of. There would be times when a character would disappear for several episodes without adequate explanation, or would appear just for the sake of reminding the viewers of their existence


Overall: 6

Shuffle brings nothing new to the table. Almost every character seems like a clone of someone else. The story is linear and fails to grab the viewer's interest. The characters are shallow, and their interactions were forced at best. Shuffle isn't bad. What it is is average. But don't take my word for it, watch a few eps for yourself.

Imagine that you live in a world where heaven and hell have merged with Earth, and that there are no longer any barriers to travel between the three.
Indeed, in this world, Gods and Demons are best friends, magic is common, and, as a high school student, you have to sit through a class on the history of all three worlds. As if regular old world history wasn't boring enough.
Now, in this world, you are suddenly given the chance to either become God or Satan. Which would you pick?
Well, there's got to be a catch, right? You're right: you have to marry either the daughter ofeither one. Now, would you still pick one?


This is the basic premiss of the anime Shuffle; Tsuchimi Rin is given the choice to pick becoming either god or Satan. Or will he decline both choices and go or another member of his harem, be it his childhood friend, his always happy and energetic senior, or the newest member of his family?


Shuffle's story is about all of this: a very stereotypical magic world harem type anime. However, there are enough twists and turns to set it apart from the average magical harem anime. It unfortunately, however, fails to impress in a very big way: it's story is not really extremely captivating and I really disliked the lack of humor in for large parts of the story. It falls short of my expectations in this category, but it really was a good story overall.


As I mentioned earlier, Tsuchimi Rin is the protagonist of this story. He is a fairly regular male, but at points, his emotions are extremely dampened and unbelievable. This may not have been the intention of the creators, in fact it probably was not, but he often lacked responses that would be natural for any human put under the enormous emotional burden that these given scenarios would generate.


We also have our five heroines in this story. Although each character brings something nice to the story, none of them are really extremely exemplary. These characters are, however are all more realistic and just in general better characters than the protagonist.


Ah, at last we move on to the supporting cast. They are, unfortunately, the virtual sole source of comedy in this show: we lack any other comic relief. They also, however, can provide very important insight into the story, and in general, are the best characters in shuffle.


While the supporting cast were a strong point of Shuffle, I feel that one of its weaker points was in its art. Sometimes, the art was fantastic,  the characters well drawn, and everything done perfectly. Other times, however, the art lacked any real finesse. The inconsistency of the art style brings it to an average level, not worthy of praise, but not requiring condemnation.


Along with the art was comes another disturbingly weak thread in this anime's tapestry: its sound. Quite honestly, at the beginning, it was dreadful: the voice actors and actresses could not really get the emotion of a topic across, and could not portray anything like it might be handled in a real life situation. One of the biggest surprises in this show, however, was the surprising increase in quality in the voice acting, to the point where the actors could be considered good by the end of the show. Combining this with an amazing opening and general sound track allows for me to say that the sound, overall, was decent.


Now, the most important part of this review: how much and why did I like Shuffle. Well, I actually liked it more than the average anime, and it gave me a fair amount of pleasure, especially as it approached the end. Although I would have typically dropped this anime after a few episodes, I'm glad that I stuck with it, and enjoyed it quite a bit, although it loses for the beginning. 


So, all things considered, Shuffle was definitely an above average show, and is worth watching if there's not much else to do, but it would have been significantly better if the voice actors had started off as well as they ended and if the main cast was more involved in the development of the story. But if you start, finish through the end, which is definitely the stronger part of the show.


So long Shuffle!

Shuffle!... it's dark and light mixed together, and I don't just mean the worlds of the Demons and the Gods.  Shuffle is an absolutely fantastic, and highly susepenseful, harem anime that can easily compete as one of the best in its genre.  If you want the "Overall Review," skip to the bottom.  Otherwise, stay tuned.
STORY:  10/10  The story in Shuffle! is very good.  There are some plot twists that might leave some viewers scratching their heads, and the ending *spoiler alert* was quite the surprise, since it runs contrary to what one would expect from reading the official descriptionof the show.  The story remains comical and lighthearted, with plenty of action throughout the first half of the season... however, at episode 12, things take a dark turn for the worst, and the show's true ability to evoke emotion in a viewer comes to life.  This dark and devastating emotional rollercoaster that follows is by far one of the most heart-wrenching I have ever experienced.... and the ending, so satisfying.


ART:  9/10  There were few, if any places, where I could confidently say the art wasn't perfect in this anime.  Overall, I'm not going to dock it much in its rating!


SOUND: 10/10  While it may seem that Sound Design doesn't really add much to an anime, the sound engineering in Shuffle! adds depth and perspective to an otherwise flat soundscape.  That, and the soundtrack is optimally timed with emotional interludes that precisely emphasize the emotions of the moment.  *Spoiler Alert*  You'll likely find yourself listening for one key song throughout the entire season, which is quite the cue for when something dramatic is about to happen.


CHARACTERS: 10/10  While a stereotypical harem anime in almost every respect, I was pleased beyond measure to see that the male hero was not a loser or a pervert.  It was nice to see a guy whose "knight in shining armor" personality really added depth to the series.  As for the girls, enough said.... they were expertly, and perfectly, crafted.


ENJOYMENT: 10/10  To girls: don't watch this series without a tissue box handy, expect a lot of tears near the middle and end.  To guys: be prepared to cough up some ego/pride and shed a man tear.  Believe it or not, this series nearly made my eyes leak a couple times, and the ending gave me goosebumps.  Enjoyable, but one heck of an emotional battle throughout.



OVERALL:  Why 10/10?  Shuffle! doesn't stereotype... it looks, sounds, and feels dramatic.  Everything about it draws you in, and the whirlpool of clashing emotions will keep you riveted to the end, which will either break your heart, or mend it... your choice.  My top favorite, and a top contender in its field.
