After playing the Shuffle! visual novel (which is, uh, a little less innocent than expected) I wasn't sure what to expect from the anime. What I got out of the anime that wasn't expressed in the visual novel was a much more intense and uncertain story line, which I enjoyed thoroughly. The first half starts out as you would expect any harem/comedy anime to start which brings a sense of undeniable comfort, however, the second half takes and unexpected twist (depending on whether you've played the novel and your definition of unexpected) and leaves you guessing, which is quite refreshing for an anime style thatis normally so predictable. 


The character progression is top notch and you really feel attached to them through the entire thing. While this is in no way an anime to rival Clannad or Kanon, for all the Key fans such as me anyway, in terms of character endearment, it by no means falls short. If you're looking for a mix of comedy, romance, and a little bit of strife and sadness, Shuffle! won't let you down.


That being said, I personally was a bit dissatisfied with the adaptation, but only because I had a set ending in my mind I think. Shuffle! is a very good love story and one I don't think you should pass up.

It is often said that there is no originality to be found when watching Harem animes. While it is mostly true at this point there is no reason not to watch one. Shuffle! is one of those harems that seems to be quite stereotypical though it does add a twist here and there. 
Story: 6
This is a harem and the story is not exactly genius. The concept of gods and demons living alongside humans kind of irked me but it wasn't so bad that I wanted to stop watching it. While bland at first it does get quite deeper, especially concerning some of the characterslike Rin, Kaede and Asa. My biggest gripe with the story is that attempts to jam too many characters in and try to work histories with them. You grow attached to a character and BAM! you don't see them for two episodes afterward. The story would have flowed so much better had there not been so many characters. Which brings me to my next point.


Characters: 6


I'm sorry but I'm not buying Rin's character. He's quite a boring fellow and his bland personality makes it difficult to believe that all these girls are after him. And while he does mean well he makes some very silly, obvious mistakes that make you want to smack him. He does redeem himself in the end (IMO) but overall he's not the best one out of the bunch. On the other hand, Asa and Kaede were done extremely well with fleshed out histories that explain their motives and reasons as to why they like Rin the way they do. While Sia and Nerine are cute I honestly feel awkward when they come on screen. If it wasn't for the fact that the story revolved around this whole demon/god world thing the story would have gotten along without them. Asa, Kaede and Rin have history behind them that could have been expanded so much more if not for Sia and Nerine needing screen time. For that the characters are alright (with Asa and Kaede being exceptional) but there are simply too many of them.


My biggest gripe about the characters is how hunky-dory they all were. Sure one of them starts to lose it (won't say who) but for the most part I feel that all these girls get along WAY too well, so much so that I was almost tempted to stop watching the show. I really wanted some more drama and hate amongst the girls and I felt that the developers failed in this aspect. I really have a hard time seeing so many girls get along with each other when they are competing for the same man. 


Art: 8


While somewhat bland at times the animation is smooth and fluid. It gets noticeably better when the girls don't have their clothes on (I'm not complaining) but overall it is pretty good.


Sound: 7


The music was kind of blah. While it suited the mood it is forgettable. However the music used for the serious interlude (the one with all five girls standing naked looking miserable) is actually quite fitting and memorable, like something terrible is about to happen. 

Voice cast wise I watched the English dub. Rin sounds...boring which suits his character. His sad voice doesn't really convince me either but he does a good job getting angry. The rest of the girls' voices fit and though not spectacular each do their job. Quite frankly I felt that Nerine's and Kaede's voice actresses did an admirable job.


Overall: 7


This anime really is the sum of all its parts. While it was not the best anime I have ever watched it was enjoyable for what it was and did get me pondering on the characters for a bit of time. If you are looking for a humorous, light hearted harem that eventually turns up the heat this could be for you.

Now before i begin i've got to say that Animes of this type really sink or swim based entirely on the protagonist. If you don't get on with the main character then you're not going to get on with the Anime as a whole. It is for that reason and that reason a lone that after watching 21 episodes of Shuffle! i decided i had had enough and to drop this Anime entirely, probably never to finish it ever (much to my shame and annoyance)! 
It started out promisingly enough, similar in many ways to other Animes of the genre, and the main character heldthe illusion of being a likeable character for much of the early episodes, tho i must say that he doesn't really stand out too much. Once i got to the mid point of the series i was finding myself getting more and more getting annoyed with him every time he opened his mouth but as i was watching the dub version i put this down to the voice actor, whom on the English dub is pretty awful (when you're shouting out at the TV "Have emotion damnit!" it's not a very good sign your getting quality acting). Having changed to the English sub on episode 15 i continued on hoping that i'll be able to reconnect with the main character and get back into the story, and it worked for a whole 3 episodes, but as the Anime got closer and closer to the final episodes his actions became more and more moronic and his emotional abuse of one of the girls got worse and worse (obviously intentional but i couldn't get on board with the way they were playing it out at all, that it was supposed to be for her own good kind of thing) and once it hit the point where you've got two of the girls just saying how much they wish this moronic arse happiness and how being with him makes one of them so very happy i was like "That's it i'm done! This scene is supposed to mean something but i've got literary no connection to it cause i just can't bring myself to root for that dick!"\n\n
So yeah, that's it for me for this Anime, which i feel is a shame as so many of the rest of the cast is so likeable and the various side stories (involving OTHER characters) were both interesting and enjoyable, tho overall this is probably just an average Anime at best. As for you if you want to give it ago i suggest watching the first few episodes yourself and make an assessment about whether you like the protagonist or not, if you do keep going and hopefully you won't be put off by his actions later on as badly as i was, if not then get out of it fast!

Shuffle! starts out as an amazingly average harem comedy, nothing really stands out or surprises if you've watched more than a few of these before.(I should probably mention that I do enjoy harem anime, some of my favorite shows fall into this category) Unfortunately the show decided that it couldn't simply be average and that it need to be special by becoming a horrible drama half way through, and in doing so became a mediocre mess. The characters are average the story is average everything is average, but this show still left a bitter taste in my mouth at the end of the final episode.If anything I respect this show because it shows the logical consequences of what a harem would be (jealousy, girls getting upset/angry, etc.), but I still didn't like it. Looking back, I find it difficult to believe that the first and second halves were even part of the same show, the tone of each is so different. \n\n
About a month after finishing the show, I was able to get my hands on an English copy of the game Shuffle! is based on (the game's name is also Shuffle!). Shuffle! the game is an average 18+ dating sim (I've played several others) with 5 arcs (Sia, Nerine, Kaede, Asa and Primula) of which I have completed 4. I'm honestly left wondering how the makers of the anime managed to screw up the show so badly after playing the game, their choices in what to include or not include seemed almost random, including plot points from every arc almost at random, leaving many of them unfinished in the anime, while also just making things up when they wanted to. Overall, I would suggest getting a copy of the game (available as a $40 download from mangagamer, or you can just get a pirated copy) and playing through each arc, you get the same story, told in a better way, with characters who are portrayed in a better way.

There really isn't anything else I can add to this review so I'll leave you off with a 'Goodbye' and 'Hope you enjoy Shuffle! if you're thinking about watching it.' Oh and have a wonderful day!

This may have been the first harem that I wish I didn’t want to kill myself watching. 
Now before you shrug this off as another generic mess of a harem, I’d like to point out that “Shuffle!” was actually a very decent show. Maybe not the best, but it certainly had its heart in the right places for the most part. Starting off with the story, it’s about as lazy as they come. The world is inhabited by three different races of people, yet it’s never fully expanded upon. It just amounts to a flashy plot device so that it doesn’t seem like typical highschool romance bull. However, since this very well establishes itself as a harem early on in the show, it’s hard to really get attached to those types of characters when they generally amount to cardboard cutout archetypes with a range of breast sizes. Though, “Shuffle!” dares to be a bit different. Essentially what it feels like is a romance that happened to be slapped the label of “harem” because, well, fuck if I know. It certainly takes a few pages from more successful harem/romance shows of the past, and when it portrays romance, it does it exceedingly well. The love stories here, though typically cliched at first glance, become much more intimate and deeper once we get to know the pieces of the puzzle, being the girls. They have a surprising amount of depth to them, and given adequate time in the spotlight to really flesh out their characters. And speaking of characters, let’s get to the main protagonist, Rin.


I usually have problems with the male lead protagonists of harems because most of the time they’re dull, clueless, idiotic dumbasses with no attractive qualities to them at all that makes you wonder why he has a slew of women chasing him. Rin… is no exception. He’s about as dull as they come, and maybe it might be due to the voice acting, but he didn’t for one second strike me as compelling enough to warrant all the attention he gets. He’s quite a two-dimensional blah, come to think of it. What really draws you in are the girls themselves (shock of the century). They’re all quirky and odd enough to be interesting, and each of them so psychologically damaged, Freud would have a field day. That’s where Rin decides to work his wonders by trying to be an advocate of joy and happiness by solving their problems. Unfortunately he’s not nearly as suave as Yukito from “Air” or Tomoya from “Clannad”, so his dull personality makes for some rather dull emotional moments too. I’m just saying, if you’re looking for an interesting central character, you’re better off being absorbed by the other girls’ backstories. The anime does decide to stray far away from harem territory somewhere in the middle when it becomes quite dark in some aspects, and very romance-centered. This is ultimately it’s strongest point.


The animation isn’t anything to get excited about, sadly. While it does it’s job, you can certainly tell it had a very tight budget to begin with, and a lot of noticeable shortcuts are taken that end up being distracting if you know what you’re looking for. In the bulk of things, it’s forgivable since you do get swept up along the way in the story, but the most praise I can give it’s style is that it’s very easy on the eyes. The soundtrack isn’t anything to get excited about either. The opening theme, while catchy, isn’t something that warrants much attention after the first few views. You’ll forget it eventually. Since I watched the English dub, I can only criticize those aspects, so I’ll just say that its passable, minus the absolutely horrendous and flat performance given by Rin’s voice actor.


In conclusion, “Shuffle!” starts off as your typical harem garbage that casually builds upon itself and takes some very sharp corners in the plot. Mid-way through the series, it shifts to being an extremely dark (and sometimes unexpectedly violent) romance that might bring some to tears. While it’s harem antiques are evident for at least the first half of the show, you’ll end up being sucked into the plot midway and be taken along for a bumpy emotional ride… if you want.

As I'm writing this I just finished Shuffle and felt like I needed to do a review of this so, how was it?
Story: 5/10
Story is your basic harem anime where several cute girls are after a guy for one reason or another (read: because he's nice.) However this anime went with a supernatural element and featured girls from the worlds of Gods and Demons which are differentiated based on how big their pointy ears (Gods had ears that looked similar to Link from Legend of Zelda while Demons have the longer elf ears.) The first half of the series, simply put, was your average haremhi-jinx's while the second half went more into each of the 5 main girls character. My biggest problem with the story is that for the most part it's ok. It's not interesting but not boring, but with the added effect of lots of things I would've wished they went into more such as: How and why did the Gods and Demons decided to come to the world of humans? How did they find Rin after 8 years? Why did they hold affection for a guy they met once for 8 years? I don't think an anime has a good story when the first 17 episodes are nothing special and the last 7 are interesting. Why is this? Well you'll find out.


Art: 4/10

Yes I realize that this anime came out in 2005 and yes I realize that anime looks much better art wise while anime in the mid 2000's are kinda ugly but there are still some nice looking anime that came out during this time. Unfotunately, Shuffle is not the anime. This anime is on par with Higurashi in terms of style, just without the random bits of horrible animation like in Higurashi and (for some reason) Shuffle's art style randomly changes, most notably in episdoes 7 and 21, which is why the score is low.


Sound: 4/10


The OP is an ok J-Rock song and the ED is alright. The reason I gave this a low score is because the OST during the show sounds like your generic visual novel OST when characters talk and such. It's...pretty bad.


Character 5/10:


This is the reason why I think the anime is what it is and the story is unintersting. Let's run down the main characters:


Rin Tsuchimi: For a harem MC he isn't too bad honestly. Yes he has some generic traits that all harem MC's have but in terms of being around women he's not afraid of them when they act lewd nor is he a massive pervert. Rather harmless character. 


Kaede Fuyou: Childhood friend who's basically acts as a doormat/housewife for Rin. She's basically a background/minor character for almost all of the anime except for her arc (episodes 19-21) where we learn why she act's like she does towards Rin and it's one of the few interesting moments of the series. However I don't think it's good a character is virtually non existant for a large majority of the series. 


Asa Shigure: Probably the character I liked the most in the series. Tomboyish and the genki girl of the series, she acts like how she does to being frail as a child with episodes of sickness as she gets older. Probably the only character throughout the whole series that is somewhat interesting.


Sia and Nerine: Putting both of them together for good reason. Sia is a princess of the world of God's while Nernie is the princess of the world of Devil's. Sia is the bubbly, energic girl of the series. She's a mix of Asa and Kaede but she's not as smart as those two. A running gag is her hitting her dad in the head with a chair WWF style. Nerine is the dignified and intelligent one, referring to characters with the -sama honorific. She can't cook so in one episode she learns to cook egg omelets (she can only cook this and becomes her running gag of sorts.) All in all, these two are rather unnecessary and uninteresting characters in the long run (their arcs in the 2nd half have the same conclusion that Rin finds out about. Don't know the best way to phrase this without spoiling anything.) These two don't really advance beyond their character type unlike the other three. If these two were gone, and the story was changed a bit, probably would've like it better.


Primula: The Dandere of the series. Somehow knows Rin (which they never explain) prior to the series and ends up living with him and Kaede. As a dandere she doesn't really talk or show emotions (which they explain in the series) but of course she eventually breaks free from being a dandere. Another decent character.


There are of course other characters but just like everything else they're not too interesting. The two kings (Sia's and Nerine's dads) are probably the best of the minor characters in the show but the rest are forgettable at best.


Enjoyment 6/10:


This is mostly because of the 2nd half (mostly the last 7 episodes.) The first half was ok but did nothing to make me like it or hate it. The last 7 were interesting, if because Kaede's arc was probably the best and (in a rare harem moment) the MC ACTUALLY PICKS A GIRL TO GO OUT WITH INSTEAD OF THE OPEN ENDED HAREM END NONSENSE. Plus the last few episodes you learn more about Asa and her mom which is..actually interesting but once again WHY DO YOU HAVE 17 EPISODES WHERE NOTHING HAPPENS THEN THE LAST 7 ARE RATHER INTERESTING?


Overall: 5/10


I didn't hate this anime nor did I like it. The characters were bland and mostly uninteresting except for Asa (and Kaede towards the end.) The overall series lacked charm. There were jokes that weren't really funny, gags that had potential (Kaede, Sia and Nerine had fanclubs that would chase Rin and at the end of the gag had some guy with binoculars crying and saying some one liner) but just felt kind of stupid mostly due to the writing. I felt the longer the series went on, the gods and demons (mostly Sia and Nerine) felt pointless. This could have been ok with better writing and less focus on Sia/Nerine (once again, the last 7 episodes prove to be the case.) The last episode had a big WTF moment which is another example that there was potential for it to be decent.  Disappointing overall as it seems like with more love and care put into the series it could've been at least decent but instead it's another harem/romcom/drama/ecchi anime that, outside of a few decent moments, falls flat. Watch if you like but don't expect too much out of this.

When I started this anime, it seemed so much like any other harem anime out there; the nice guy who is surrounded by beautiful women who all adore him.  But as I got further into the story I was surprised at how deep some emotions go.  
There is a sort of mold this anime could fit into.  If you've seen Love Hina, if you've seen Ichigo 100%, shows like that, you can just about guess what will generally happen in this anime.  However, there's a few quality traits that set Shuffle! apart from these other animes.  
First of all, thecharacters and their art level.  Each person in the anime has their own unique qualities, their own personality.  I found that I could identify with a lot of them so easily, as they seemed so human (although they were often a god or demon).  You begin to realize that this isn't just about multiple beautiful women and one lucky guy.  I personally would hate to be in this guy's position, having so many women falling that deep in love with you, having to break all but one's heart...  \n
But I digress.  There are a few moments where character interaction seems forced, where a comment, an emotional outburst or something else, seems out of place and rather... awkward.  Most of the time it all flows, all seems to logically piece together.  \n
As for the art, this anime was well drawn.  Nothing too special, but it's pretty fantastic, to me.  There are several pantie shots, and surprisingly, quite a few nude chest shots, at least one of each girl.  These too, are well drawn and seem somewhat natural (come on, a high school girl with DD size?) but not too fake.  There's a model ship that Rin is working on, and each shot of the ship itself is well drawn, lots of detail into it.  \n\n
Overall, there's quite a few things that make me love this anime but those other things that made me somewhat hesitant about it.  I would recommend this anime to someone who enjoys harem styled anime, someone who also enjoys realistic romance, truly falling in love, not some silly "I've just met you once but I'll give you my whole body!" line.  (Although there is something similar... ha)  I doubt any hardcore action fans will enjoy this, so make sure you like the sappy romance and mild drama before you start this.

But in the end, everything turns out happy. Overall I really liked this anime and would recommend people to watch it when given the chance.

Overall rating for this fantastic Romantic Comedy Series? 10, for I was personally drawn to the amazing series.
Story - 10. The story was quite well planned, every episode had it's feud, and every episode had it's twists; furthermore, the entire story also had it's epic moments. I love the overall story and how each episode played into it.
Art - 10. Perfect animation, and greatly detailed art, I couldn't have been more happy.
Sound - 10. I ravaged the internet for the Original SoundTrack for this series. Does that tell you how much I enjoyed the sound? Plus, the voice actors did a great job in makingme feel like they were actually at the scene, but that doesn't seem to be a hard feat in modern anime anymore.\n\n
Character - 10. There was in depth history to each and every character, most had a dark past that at times, made me wonder why I wasn't crying for them. The main character himself was amazing, though he was the only character without any real background history I suppose.\n\n
Enjoyment - 10. It's one of those romantic comedies that makes you want to experience it for yourself. The problems each character faces isn't very far from realistic, and very easily connectable by the watcher.\n\n
Overall - 10. Awesome average, I loved this series. I'd watch the next season if they ever come out with one.

A fun anime series worth watching...
Shuffle is a harem-style anime. The story is a little contrived, in that three of the girls interested in our hero Rin are daughters of supernatural beings. Still, you get to know all the characters and eventually you can't help but have your favorite girl. Towards the end, there are various adventures, both every-day and supernatural. I by the middle of the series, I was definitely rooting for one girl in particular, but in the end I was disappointed with our hero's final choice. I would have given this show only 6/10, but since Rin did make a choice inthe end, I give one more star for that, rather than having the story end leaving it open.

To some extent, once you’ve seen one harem show you’ve seen them all. I think there were several aspects that made Shuffle! unique, especially in it’s second half. . Also, while the characters are, just by the nature of the show, probably going to be a bit excessively enthusiastic about the male lead, I don’t think it was overdone.Once the series enters it’s second half, it starts getting into the main character’s backgrounds, resulting in a darker and more serious turn in the series. I find this half of the show to be the more interesting half, since we start dealing with actual issues andproblems with the characters instead of just happily going around flashing panties, which is what mostly happens in the first half of the series. \n\n

This series was really well done. I really enjoyed it. It is the basic harem scenario 1 guy many girls (which to choose type) but what makes Shuffle! different in my opinion is the way they deliver it. The characters are really unique and there are many funny moments. The plot slowly build up and is pretty good. This anime is basically for those of you who enjoy a happy cheerful storyline with many humorous moments. Also it may seem like it is going slow but it is not. The plot builds up at a good pace, and the ending was great. Also one keything I love about this anime is that it isn't like many harem situation where who the protagonist love can be predicted almost like right off the bat. You have to watch it, because it slowly creeps in almost unnoticeable. Which I really loved. Overall, just go watch it, give it a try, it really is a good anime. :D

In a relationship sense, this anime is a textbook example as to why a harem can be both the most amazing and the worst thing of your life. Still though, decisions that majorly affect your personal status with a larger number of close people, is never and easy choice to make.
'Shuffle!' is an anime where the first half is so boringly slow and predictable it's almost hard to describe in words because instead of keeping tabs on the story, you're already thinking what happens three steps down the track just to pass the time until something worthwhile happens. A little after the half way markis where it really picks up and things start rolling at a much more interesting pace where it makes you want to watch the next episode instead of dragging you on like a boring chore. It really does make up for it.


Art for scenery and backgrounds are most times Pleasing to the eye and well made however animation is quite the let down. The style at random times looses quality and looks as if a middle schooler made it. While it may be for comedic purposes, it more often kills the joke. Animated object more times than not can easily be picked out from the rest of the scenery which stands out to the point of almost looking out of place.


Sound and Music are well placed and well made even if a lot are repeated more times than you can count and some pieces sound very similar to that of some other well known anime. The singing voices too sound all to similar as if they just recorded it once and put it in multiple places in the anime and sometimes ruins the mood the scene and dialogue had created.


Characters are a major plus for this anime as each character is played out really well in terms of build up, learning to love and emotional breakdown later on. However one let down is that some characters could have done with a bit more screen time with explaining themselves or who they previously were instead of start to finish in but a couple of episodes.


Overall enjoyment is somewhat par as the first half of the anime is immensely slow to build up, play out and bridge one where as the second half plays it out a lot faster, more dramatic and a lot deeper. One scene towards the end will even send shivers up your spine. (warning do not watch the final two episodes after having a large feed as weak stomachs will lose it) Before finally the attempted prologue that just reverts back to the grade schoolers art style.

This is  actually an  excellent series , which  proved to be   a great  watch and provided   me  much enjoyment , throughout.
Beware  ,Its not your run of the mill Harem ( comedy) story and at times  pulls  no  punches.Its actually a bit more of  a Romance /spice of life affair.
The Voice work is superb , fitting all the characters  just so well. I  agree  whole heartily , with a previous  reviewer , who   stated to view   this   series  inanything  other than the  subbed version , would be a crime. 


The art work , is very  good and the  character  development is excellent. we are treated  to a real examination's  of their past , presents fears  ups and downs.losing  out in love hurts  and this is one anmie  not afraid to show it.


My main   gripe  is  the writing or storyline.


Whilst the characters back  stories , hopes , dreams and relationships  are on the whole developed well,there  is  quite a bit of  contrived writing  or lose  ends , that to be honest  don't  fully explain  everything  or just  were  not needed(.i.e  the whole last two episodes  or three.) .It  kind  of  loses  focus or steam  and  ends  with a pretty generic ending.(Hence  mark of  8 instead of 9) 


This is a real shame, because it  ruined  a really  great anmie , with HUGE potential. That said , this is a great  anmie and  is well worth  watching.
For the most part, it's a story of a triangle love all pointing at one high school student. There is lot more to it in the story, even some psychological parts.

Watching Animes to pass your time seems quite the thing these days, and well, when I pick my animes, I pick 'em by the Genres. Shuffle! is not unique in it's type, that we can all deduce (Ecchi, Harem, Comedy type of Anime is more than all too common). However, after I finished watching the series, I noticed that whoever uploaded the Anime forgot to add "Drama" to the genres, and that's where the series goes wrong.
First off, the characters' personalities are absolutely superb, all of them seem fitting to the supposed "Ecchi-Harem-Comedy" series, and the author did a job well done with that. Theart is also very eye-catching and neat. However, this review will only get worse:


The voice actors in this anime are all "fine". But "fine" isn't enough. How many times did you laugh when one ( or all ) of the characters scream: "EEEEEEEEEEHHHHHHHHHHH!?!?" or "NANNNNNIIIIIII!?!?" in surprise. Well, in Shuffle!, the voice actors lack that kind of talent, and couldn't bring themselves to act at their fullest. Not to mention the often, awkward sound effect accompanying the voices, as if it's being recorded in a poor, low-quality studio.


All of the above are relatively fine, and could not be mentioned, but my main complaint is the story, especially the ending. First of all, being Gods and Demons incorporated in the story, their presence and power AS GODS and DEMONS is barely shown. It's like it's barely touching the "Magic" genre involved in the description. That said, the main character, Tsuchimi Rin's decisions across the story are questionable, as well as some of the characters' pasts. I cannot even count how many times I shouted at my screen: "DUDE, WHAT THE F*** ARE YOU DOING?! CAN'T YOU SEE WHAT'S GOING ON!?". The story's integrity and whole point, actually, nearly vanished around the final episodes. The whole point of: "Who will be his girlfriend?" completely disappears, and turns into: "Wow, look at how devoted he is", which is not cool at all. Not to mention that he gave up the opportunity to become GOD or SATAN! WHAT A FOOL! And about the characters pasts, it seems that the authors has a fetish with schizophrenia or something, as well as dark and depressing stories.


All of the paragraph above could be absolutely avoided if it had a "DRAMA"

genre in the description, which it obviously didn't. Of course, a bit of Drama in any series is inevitable, but the Drama here plays a way too significant part. And the Comedy part is almost not playing any role at all to boot.



To conclude: If you want to watch a half-Ecchi, Drama, Harem, Romance and abusive use of Magic - Fantasy, then watch this series (By abusive I mean that it's used only to force constitutive moments in the series, which is kinda' cheap). Do not expect any worthwhile comedy, though. And be ready to get disappointed and extremely pissed off.


6 is the Score for this.

Story: 4
While the romance aspect of the story was barely feasible at best, the other elements of the plotline were completely bullshit, with much of it being unoriginal, unrealistic, and unentertaining.
Art: 5
Nothing special, what you would expect from an anime of its time, minus a bit.
Sound: 7
The OP sounds nice, and the soundtracks are generally suited to the atmosphere
Character: 2
The girls are mostly mediocre except for one or two, who are unique to some extent. We have our typical tropes: Playful senpai, big chested oujo sama, cheerful airhead, considerate childhood friend. These are then mixed with a few twists that give them a bit offlavor, judging by the girls alone, I would score the characters a 7. However, when balanced out with the MC, the net character score becomes a 2. \n\n
The MC is your typical thickheaded man of mediocrity, except he lacks any common sense whatsoever, is extremely fickle and shallow, and shows no understanding and empathy to anyone around him, including those he has known literally all his life. Scoring this a 1 was very tempting just out of my desire to spite the dumb MC.\n\n
Enjoyment: 3\n\n
While I did enjoy the girls very much, this enjoyment was constantly hampered and destroyed by the MC. Some may find him tolerable, but as someone who has watched many, many harems with dumb MCs, I'm appalled by the fact that I still find his actions retarded, his train of thought impaired. Thus, the constant frustration I felt while grinding through the anime, especially over the last 6-8 episodes, completely ruined the enjoyment aspect.\n\n
Overall: 3\n\n
This show is a 7 without the retarded MC, a generous 3 with. \n

Ok my friends, it is time for a very rare time I give a glowing review on a remarkable anime work. This time I set out on Shuffle!, one of the many recommendations I got from other users as far as harems and supernatural types of anime goes. And I must say, I was blown away by some of the plot points and twists that went with them. I got jerked around back and forth so many times in all the right ways with what was going to happen next and who it would happen too. This anime is not just a comedy, my dearreaders. It is a veritable plethora of so many blended elements that begins as a run of the mill until you get engrossed by around episode 3. When things took off I was completely glued to the story. I felt for the characters, and I saw how a kindhearted person could be in a number of situations yet remain a good natured, helpful individual. I refuse to spoil as many parts of this show as I can and will be short here. WATCH THIS SHOW! it is as simple as that. Like I said, I had no idea how things were going to turn out, but I totally wish it would have taken longer to get there because I wanted to see so much more. This show just was not long enough for me. I liked it so much that the time flew by on me. It will suck you in that well, and I will again say to you all, if you are a harem, drama, supernatural, comedy anime fan. This one needs to be in your library.

This series is an enjoyable harem comedy right up until about episode eighteen where for all intents and purposes the series ends, but for some reason the writers failed to grasp the quintessential point of a harem comedy and continue the series for another five or six episodes. Five or six episodes filled with painfully over-angsty character "development" which sullies your previous opinion of most of the characters and which towards the end involves a tediously telegraphed plot twist. It’s a pity really as a little bit of plot re-scheduling would really have saved what had previously been an enjoyable experience.

So this anime is about a guy named Rin Suchimi who is a normal high school student. Although this anime is interesting in that demons and gods live amongst humans it is sort of a romance anime. There are five girls who are in love with Rin. The first girl is named Kaede and she and Rin have lived together since they were kids. Rin went to live with kaede and her father after his parents died in a car accident along with Kaede's mother. Now that Rin and Kaede are old enough Kaede's father goes on business trips that last months. So while herfather is away she takes care of Rin as if they were married. There are two new students that come to Rins school and they both love him do to a past experience eight years earlier. There names are Nerine and sia. They are the daughters of the kings of the god and demon world. There fathers try to pressure Rin to marry one of them. There is also asa i childhood friend and a very energetic person. She doesn't start out loving Rin in the start of this an anime she falls for him later in the story. Then there is primula a demon who was a test subject for a experiment to cure any ailment that a demon or god might have. This experiment caused primula to lose all emotion she can not feel love,hate,happiness, or sadness. Though when she saw Rin her feeling came out. this was a very good anime and is worth watching.

Through the first half of the series I thought this was a pretty good anime and one that I enjoyed watching.  Sadly the second half of the series was hit by a disturbing and depressing truck.  I felt like I was watching a Girls Bravo type anime in the beginning of the series and then all of a sudden your treated to a Perfect Blue type anime at the end.  It just threw off the series for me.  Shuffle has pretty much everything an anime could have, It had comedy, suspense, drama, romance, and even fan service for those who areinterested.  In all it's not bad but just know what you're getting into before you decide to watch it.  Also if you have a heart somewhere in your body you will cry at least once during this series.
